sen.j: 顕智（けんち、嘉禄2年（1226年） - 延慶 (日本)3年7月4日 (旧暦)（1310年7月30日）?）は、鎌倉時代中期の浄土真宗の僧。
sen.e: Kenchi (1226 - July 30, 1310 ?) was a monk of the Jodo shin shu (True Pure Land Sect Buddhism) in the mid Kamakura period.

Kenchi (1226 - July 30, 1310 ?) was a monk of the Jodo Shinshu (True Pure Land Sect of Buddhism) in the mid Kamakura period.

sen.j: 初め比叡山で出家・修行し、賢順と号したという。
sen.e: It is said that he first became a priest in Hiei-zan Mountain and practiced asceticism, and he used Kenjun as a pseudonym.

sen.j: 浄土真宗の祖親鸞の弟子真仏に師事し、その後親鸞の直弟子となって顕智と改めたという。
sen.e: He studied under Shinbutsu, a disciple of Shinran who was a founder of Jodo shin shu, and later became Shinran's direct disciple and changed his name to Kenchi.

sen.j: 常に親鸞に随行し、親鸞が京に戻る際にも従った。
sen.e: He always went with and followed Shinran and attended on him when he came back to Kyoto.

sen.j: 真仏が没した後の1258年（正嘉2年）には、真宗高田派の本山である専修寺の3世を継ぎ、覚信尼を助けて大谷廟堂の造営に力を注いだ。
sen.e: In 1258, after Shinshu died, he succeeded the third Senju-ji Temple, Shinshu Sect Takada school head temple and helped Kakushinni and devoted himself to build Otani-byodo Mausoleum.

sen.j: 一説によれば浄土真宗で初めて法印・大僧都に叙任されたと伝えられる。
sen.e: According to one theory, he was appointed to Hoin (the highest rank among Buddhist priests) and Daisozu (the upper Buddhist priests in the second highest position) for the first time in Jodo shin shu.
